events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred yesterday involving a collision with another vehicle on Main Street.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords detected such as car, collision, and accident in the initial report.
An insurance agent with expertise in auto claims was assigned to handle the case to ensure prompt assistance for the customer.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer, confirming receipt of the accident report and outlining the next steps.
Requested additional documents including photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and driver’s license copy for verification.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed images of the collision damage and the official police report.
Investigation into the automobile accident was initiated to review the submitted evidence and assess liability and damage.
Investigation findings completed indicating that the customer was not at fault and damage assessment is consistent with the collision details.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs of the damaged vehicle, based on the assessment from the investigation.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely updates throughout the claim process.
The insurance claim was officially approved after review of investigation results and customer agreement on the settlement terms.
Payment corresponding to the settlement amount was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and customer’s confirmation that repairs have commenced.
